Food is any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for an organism. Food is usually of plant, animal or fungal origin, and contains essential nutrients, such as carbohydrates, fats, proteins, vitamins, or minerals. The substance is ingested by an organism and assimilated by the organism's cells to provide energy, maintain life, or stimulate growth.

Protein is a nutrient needed by the human body for growth and maintenance. Aside from water, proteins are the most abundant kind of molecules in the body. Protein can be found in all cells of the body and is the major structural component of all cells in the body, especially muscle.
Protein.

Protein is a nutrient needed by the human body for growth and maintenance. Aside from water, proteins are the most abundant kind of molecules in the body. Protein can be found in all cells of the body and is the major structural component of all cells in the body, especially muscle. This also includes body organs, hair and skin. Proteins are also used in membranes, such as glycoproteins. When broken down into amino acids, they are used as precursors to nucleic acid, co-enzymes, hormones, immune response, cellular repair, and other molecules essential for life. Nutrition is the science that interprets the interaction of nutrients and other substances in food in relation to maintenance, growth, reproduction, health and disease of an organism.
Nutrition is the provision, to cells and organisms, of the materials necessary (in the form of food) to support life.
The food on the counter is nutritious.
The nutritional value of a food is the amount of energy that is provided by the food.
Nutrition is the process by which an organism obtains food and uses it for growth, metabolism and repair.
Meat is animal flesh that is eaten as food.
meat, fruits, vegetables, grains, eggs, cheese, milk, nuts, butter, oil, honey, jelly
Fruit and vegetables are a good source of vitamins and minerals, fibre and other substances that are important for good health. Most of us need to eat more of them.
Red meat is meat from mammals, which is red when raw.
Cheese provides protein, calcium, phosphorus, and other nutrients that help keep bones healthy and strong.
The nutrition facts label is a label required on most packaged food in many countries.
